edge: The film 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is based on the Marvel Comics character Spider-Man.
Co-produced by Columbia Pictures and Marvel Studios, 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is distributed by Sony Pictures Releasing.
Co-produced by Columbia Pictures and Marvel Studios, 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is distributed by Sony Pictures Releasing.
Distributed by Sony Pictures Releasing, 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is a 2021 American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character Spider-Man.
Starring Tom Holland as Peter Parker / Spider-Man in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Co-starring Zendaya as Mia Mallory in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Starring Benedict Cumberbatch as Dr. Stephen Strange in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Co-starring Jacob Batalon as Ned Leeds in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Co-starring Jon Favreau as Happy Hogan in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Starring Jamie Foxx as Electro (Max Dillon) in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Starring Willem Dafoe as Norman Osborn / Green Goblin in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Starring Alfred Molina as Doctor Octopus (Otto Octavius) in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Co-starring Benedict Wong as Wong in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Co-starring Tony Revolori as Flash Thompson in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Starring Marisa Tomei as May Parker in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Starring Andrew Garfield as Peter Parker / Spider-Man (Amazing) in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
Starring Tobey Maguire as Peter Parker / Spider-Man (Classic) in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.
'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is the 27th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).
The film 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is directed by Jon Watts.
The screenplay of the film 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is written by Chris McKenna.
The screenplay of the film 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is also written by Erik Sommers.
Third MCU Spider-Man film was planned during the production of Homecoming in 2017.

Negotiations between Sony and Marvel Studios to alter their deal ended with Marvel Studios leaving the project in August 2019, but a negative fan reaction led to a new deal between the companies a month later.
Spider-Man appears in both the MCU Spider-Man films and the previous Spider-Man films directed by Sam Raimi and Marc Webb.
No Way Home serves as a crossover between the MCU and the previous Spider-Man films directed by Sam Raimi and Marc Webb.
Several actors reprise their roles from those films, including previous Spider-Man actors Maguire and Garfield.

Discusses their battles with Spider-Man, Osborn, Octavius, and Dillon realize they were pulled from their universes just before their deaths.

Strange prepares to reverse the contained spell and send the villains back to their respective universes, but Peter argues that they should first help each villain to possibly change their fates upon their return.
Realizes that the Goblin persona has retaken control of Osborn and convinces the other villains to betray Peter.
Before she dies, May tells Peter that "with great power, there must also come great responsibility".
Peter uses Stark Industries technology to cure Octavius.

After realizing that the only way to protect the multiverse is to erase himself from everyone's memory, Peter-One creates a new Spider-Man suit and resumes his vigilantism in New York City. This shows that Peter-One still values his superhero identity as Spider-Man and is committed to protecting the city.

While mourning at May's grave, Peter-One has a conversation with Hogan and is inspired to carry on. This shows that Peter-One still deeply cares for his deceased aunt and finds solace in visiting her resting place.

Peter-One visits MJ to reintroduce himself, but decides against it. This shows that Peter-One still has a close relationship with Mary Jane and values their connection, but also faces the challenge of balancing his dual identities as Spider-Man and Peter Parker.

Eddie Brock leaves behind a piece of the Venom symbiote as he unknowingly returns to his respective universe. This shows that the symbiote still has an association with Eddie Brock and could potentially cause problems in the future.

In the sequel, Rhys Ifans reprises his role as Dr. Curt Connors from 'The Amazing Spider-Man'. Connors' attempt to regrow his missing arm leads him to transform into a large reptilian monster called Lizard, causing chaos in the city and becoming Spider-Man's nemesis.

Thomas Haden Church reprises his role as Flint Marko from 'Spider-Man 3'. After receiving an ability to transform into sand, Marko becomes a small-time thief and causes trouble for Spider-Man. In this movie, he appears in archival footage.

Charlie Cox reprises his role as Matt Murdock from the Netflix series. Though there is no clear indication of how he will appear in this movie, his presence in the Spider-Man universe has been confirmed.
Tom Hardy appears as Eddie Brock, the man who eventually becomes Venom in Sony's Spider-Man Universe. In this movie, he makes an uncredited cameo appearance in the mid-credits scene.

Development on third and fourth MCU Spider-Man films had begun by August 2019. The existing deal between Marvel Studios and Sony allowed Marvel and Feige to produce the Spider-Man films for Sony and receive 5% of their revenue.
Marvel Studios president Kevin Feige was contracted to return for one more Spider-Man film in August 2019.
Feige produces the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) franchise already.
Development on third and fourth MCU Spider-Man films had begun by August 2019, with Sony hoping Holland and director Jon Watts would return for both.
Disney expressed concern with Feige's workload producing the MCU franchise already and asked for a 25–50% stake in any future films Feige produced for Sony.
The existing deal between Marvel Studios and Sony allowed Marvel and Feige to produce the Spider-Man films for Sony and receive 5% of their revenue.
By August 2019, Marvel Studios and its parent company The Walt Disney Studios had spent several months discussing expanding their deal with Sony.
Director Jon Watts had completed his two-film deal and would need to sign on for any more films in August 2019.
The third film in the Spider-Man franchise was still in development by the time of Sony's announcement, with McKenna and Sommers writing the screenplay.
In August 2019, Disney expressed concern with Feige's workload producing the MCU franchise already and asked for a 25–50% stake in any future films Feige produced for Sony.
The existing deal between Marvel Studios and Sony allowed Marvel and Feige to produce the Spider-Man films for Sony and receive 5% of their revenue.
Unable to come to an agreement, Sony announced that it would be moving forward on the next Spider-Man film without Feige or Marvel's involvement.

In the given context, Jon Watts was offered to direct large films for other studios instead of returning to the Spider-Man: Far From Home franchise. The agreement allowed Holland's Spider-Man to appear in a future Marvel Studios film, indicating a collaboration and potential cross-over between the two franchises.

The agreement also allowed Holland's Spider-Man to appear in Sony's shared universe and for the two franchises to acknowledge details between each other, described as a 'call and answer' between the two.

The filmmakers considered giving Murdock a larger role than originally planned but ultimately decided against it to avoid shifting the focus away from the main character.

Marisa Tomei confirmed she would return as May Parker in the film. The filmmakers discussed featuring more of her work as a community organizer, but ultimately decided against it to avoid shifting the focus away from Spider-Man.

node_2: fake logos with the titles spider-man: phone home, spider-man: home-wrecker, and spider-man: home slice
edge: In late February 2021, Holland, Batalon, and Zendaya released three stills featuring their characters from the film alongside fake logos with the titles Spider-Man: Phone Home, Spider-Man: Home-Wrecker, and Spider-Man: Home Slice. This suggests a potential connection between these logos and the other fake titles, which may represent villains in the film.
The use of fake titles and logos, such as Spider-Man: Phone Home, can be seen as a fictional marketing gimmick to generate hype and intrigue around the film's true title.
The Phone Home title is a reference to a line from E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982), implying that both titles are related in some way.
The Home-Wreacker title may suggest that the movie has elements of a 1990s thriller film.

Gregory Lawrence of Collider compared the stills to the 'terrifying/awe-inspiring wonder' of Steven Spielberg films and The Goonies (1985), implying a relationship between the Home-Wrecker title, the film's visuals, and Spielberg's style.

The marketing team for Sony's Spider-Man: No Way Home is in coordination with Disney to ensure they both benefit from the release of MCU-related content. This helps prevent scheduling conflicts and keeps fans informed about upcoming Marvel releases.

An apparent leak of the first trailer for Spider-Man: No Way Home was shared on social media, causing online 'fervor' and raising expectations among fans. While some outlets deemed it a legitimate leak, Sony worked to have various copies taken down.
There is speculation that Sony may be wary of committing marketing that notes the film's December 2021 release date due to the resurgence of the COVID-19 Delta variant.

Spider-Man: No Way Home is a part of Phase Four of the MCU.
Spider-Man: No Way Home was released in the United States on December 17, 2021.
Spider-Man: No Way Home had its world premiere at Fox Village Theatre in Hollywood, Los Angeles.
Spider-Man: No Way Home was initially set to be released on July 16, 2021.
Spider-Man: No Way Home was pushed back to November 5, 2021, before it was further pushed back to the December 2021 date due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Spider-Man: No Way Home is distributed by Sony Pictures.
Sony and CJ 4DPlex announced a deal to release Spider-Man: No Way Home in the ScreenX format.

There have been reports that Spider-Man: No Way Home will be released in China, but as of February 2022, there has been no release date due to diplomatic tensions between the country and the United States.
Chinese authorities reportedly requested for the Statue of Liberty to be removed from Spider-Man: No Way Home in order for it to be released in China, but Sony refused.
In March 2024, Sony announced that all of their live-action Spider-Man films would be re-released in theaters as part of Columbia Pictures' 100th anniversary celebration.
An extended cut of the film, subtitled The More Fun Stuff Version, was announced in June 2022.
The introduction by Holland, Maguire, and Garfield was included in the re-release.
Additional scenes of Parker and May being interrogated by the Department of Damage Control were included.
An additional scene of Harry as a thief was included.
Additional scenes of Parker's first day back at school and the arrivals of Dillon and Marko were included.
Additional scenes of Brant interviewing Parker, his teachers, and his classmates were included.
Additional scenes in the basement of the New York Sanctum were included.
An additional scene featuring May, Parker, and the villains in an elevator while on the way to Hogan's apartment was included.
An additional scene with Murdock and Hogan was included.
The new post-credits scene replaced the teaser trailer of Multiverse of Madness and showcased the effects of Strange's second spell.

The poster for the extended cut of 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' has an 'Avengers-style poster with a perfect blend of multiverse feels, combined with the 'Where's Waldo' effect', as mentioned by Shrishty Mishra from Collider.
Sony continued to play coy on the cameos after the film had released, as mentioned by Russ Burlingame from ComicBook.com.
Spider-Man: No Way Home was released on digital download on March 15, 2022.
Spider-Man: No Way Home was released on Ultra HD Blu-ray, Blu-ray, and DVD on April 12.
Sony Pictures Home Entertainment released Spider-Man: No Way Home on digital download on March 15, and on Ultra HD Blu-ray, Blu-ray, and DVD on April 12.
Following the leak of Blu-ray versions of the film to torrent sites, Sony moved the digital release up from March 22 to March 15.
The home media release of Spider-Man: No Way Home includes a gag reel.
The home media release of Spider-Man: No Way Home includes various behind-the-scenes featurettes.

The home media release of Spider-Man: No Way Home includes two roundtable discussions: one with Alfred Molina, Willem Dafoe, and Jamie Foxx, and another with Tom Holland, Tobey Maguire, and Andrew Garfield.

In the United States and Canada, No Way Home earned $121.85 million (which included $50 million from its Thursday night previews) on its opening day, becoming the second-highest opening film after Endgame ($157.4 million)

node_2: second-highest domestic box office opening of all time

node_2: arguably the most important movie to the movie theater industry ever
edge: Comscore Senior Media Analyst Paul Dergarabedian called the film 'arguably the most important movie to the movie theater industry ever', as it helped show the viability of the movie theater industry and the benefit of theatrical release windows while the industry recovered from the COVID-19 pandemic.

The release of The More Fun Stuff Version of No Way Home had an impact on the box office due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, causing it to return to first place and surpass the earnings of other recent releases.
Endgame previously held the record for the highest opening weekend box office gross for a re-released MCU film, but No Way Home surpassed it during its own re-release.
Before being surpassed by No Way Home's re-release, Far From Home held the record for the highest opening weekend box office gross for a re-released MCU film.
